DIV1.HEAD: The Courant out of Italy and Germany, &c.

DIV2.P: THere is advise out of Spaine / that there were in Sivile eight of the Holland shipps seques∣tred; the like also is done in all the Sea havens of Spayne for to helpe therwith Marmora.

The letters of the 30. of Iuny give advise / that the mighty army of the Turck / was gone from Adrianopolis towards the Moldaw / and that there were daily more folkes sent unto it / both horsemen and footmen: the Bassa Bustain is to be the Gouvernour in Galata / S'cutary / and in all places unto the black sea: he hath many shipps wel armed / for to withstand the Cosaques / who doe as yet much harme in that black sea.

The famous Pirate / Samson / hath desyred of this Seigniory / a free incoming with all his / and as some thinck: for to inhabite to Pola in Istria: upon which condition he offers to this Seigniory 36. wel armed shipps with one million of gold for a gift against tyme of need: more-over two milli∣ons of gold / for ten in the hondert / besides other conditions: the Secretary Ancelay hath already commission to treate with hin of these things.

OPENER.DATELINE: Out of Breslaw, the 4. of August.

DIV2.P: The Marquis of Iagherendorp hath burnt more than the half of the town of Nieudischen in Moravie / 5. duith myles from Olmits / which hath / constreined the horsmen of the Emperour to depart thence for need / which being inviron∣ned by the soldiers of the said Marquis they ha∣ve killed of them wel eight hondert / some say a thousand / al of them being choise men: from thence the same Iagerendorps folkes are al gone towards Olmits and burnt the suburbes ther∣of / and afterwards / as is reported / taken the sa∣me per force: many places in Moravie doe yeeld themselves willingly / for ther is much feare / and few garnisons. It is reported that the Mar∣quis Leger is now 24. thousand strong: but be∣cause the Magistrats ar here good Imperialists / and the subieces hold for the King / ther is here so much misery for the comon people / that it is wō∣der. The smal town of Brieg is hept with one company of soldiers: the Our is parted and ther is to Neus 2. Enseignes of soldiers: 3 Enseignes also passed yesterday this way: The soldiers of Saxe have taken in Swems and Grotoclockow. This town hath yet taken in on company more / they be now 800. men / 200. ar upon the Dom / who ar payd by the clargy: 600. by the cityzens / al is pityfult: ther comes yet more Saxons in the land: for to further the ruyne of it: and as some write / from Moravie: ther ar already more than 3000. of the Enperour soldiers kild in Moravy.

OPENER.DATELINE: Out of Chur, in Swytserland the 8. dito.

DIV2.P: The Knyt Robustely having receyved certen advys / that the King of Spayne was resolved to restore the Land of Deltolin to the inhabitans therof / hath called them togither / and requyred of them te submit agayn onder the power of the Con∣federate and in case that they would hold him for theyr head and swear unto him / he would deffend them against the Confederate: but as some of the Nobility did dissuade the comon people fromit / he is hierupon entred in great choler / and caused so∣me to be executed: wherupon that people have di∣vided them selves in two parts the one holding with Robustely / and the other with the Nobility / so as they kill one another wher thy can / so as a great murdering one of another is to be feared: the fift of this moneth ar passed 28. Companyes of Italians ad Spanisch soldiers torough Deltolin towards Tyrol / and from thense going towards Hongary: the soldiers also of Leopold / ar sayd to goe the same waye / but these have great need of mony / they have in ten wekes not receyved above ten styvers / or a schelling / a moneth.

Bethlehem Gabor with his folkes / is not far from Presvourg he doeth much harme: the city∣zens of Presbourg ar disarmed: because theris no trust between the soldiers and them: their Wyves and children ar fled this waye / the soldiers within Presbourg will have mony / or use some other mea∣nes: the soldiers of the Emperour aryet vnder Presbourg / not far one from another: their is also a Bridge over the river of Danaw / upō the which Colaldo can come to them.

The Marquis of Iagerendorp hath bin by Bethlehem Gabor / what they have treated of / is not knowen: ther ar yet some 1000 Hongers co∣me in the camp of Iagerendorp / which doe much hurt in Moravie. The General Spinelly wil depart from Moravie / wherupon flamings ar sent thither.
Hier ar Patens ready for to send to the Empi∣re / wherin is an oppresse commandement unto all Officers and soldats onder Mansvelt / to for∣sake that service vpon peine of leesing body and goods.

The city of Tabor is yet besigd / assayled with great ordonnance and all other meanes / so wel of accord as otherwise / wher at they within seem but to mocke at / willing to fight unto the very last man: wherupon ther were yet yesterday sent from hence 4. great peces of ordonnance.

The pardon given by the Emperour is not yet published here: the Deputyes of Silesia ar yes∣terday returned with great contentment from Dienna hier / they have promised to the Empe∣rour 300. thousend Florins / to be payd in 3. ter∣mes: two dayes agon is vassed here the high con∣sel of the Empire / for to goe to the Elector of Saxe: it is for to set a day of consultation for the affaires of the Empire.

Yesterday at the Hongres / being about 8000 strong / fallen upon the March / about a mile from hence / and have burnt many villages / and among other Lichtensteen / the corne also is wholly burnt / the old folkes ar kild / and the yong driven awaye like cattel / there hath bin such a fyer that the light therof could be seen hier over all the town in the aier: the Emperour himself is mounted upon an high tower of the Castle for to see it: the Hongres have parted themselves in 13. companyes / and have the last night roved so far as Cremnits / wher they have / as is reported / burnt 70 Dillad∣ges / no body withstand them / for ther ar no for∣ces / the shutting hath bin heard here from the Closter Neuburg: and as the Duc Carles with Don Marthias would yesterday morning have gone by spp to the Closter Neuburg / they did escape the Honges very narowly / and there is such a running hier of yong and old / that it can hardly be spoken / so as the suburbes ar full.

At Lumpenbourg and other places in Moravie the Hongres have also spoiled all. Our folckes ar yet by Presbourg / not being about 6000 strong / they have not long since take two of Bethlehems great men / whom they would not lett live / which hath yet more inflammed Gabor against vs / who hath also taken many of our Comtes and Lords / as also Dampiers brother / so as it appeares that the hand of God is upon this Land.

Men doe writte out of the Palsland / that leave is graunted unto the Soldiers for to lodge in the Bishoprck of Spier / and commanded that they should not lake nor meat nor drinck. The coun∣trymen of Plenicamer / though it was forbidden them / have begon to shut upon the Soldiers / and killed and hurt some of them / and left them in middest of the streets / but the soldiers have sett in furye upon the clounes and have killed and hurt some of them / and ther upon the soldiers and hor∣semen have begon to spoile.

The Marquis Spinola hath his Soldiers be∣tween Mastrie and Tongeren / where he hath made his monstering / he is about 15 thousand strong of footmen and horsemen / they will forme two camps / the one to marche twards Geylen∣kerque / and the other towards Dure: he hath wonderfull instruments with him / as some thou∣sand Lanternes / Bootes / 16 shaloppes / to carye soldiers over / and 2 great shipps for to passe over horses / one 140 Waggens / with shoofles and spa∣des / Corde-waggens / as also obout an hondert Waggons with gown pouder / meel / Ovens and other things of the like nature: it is reported that Don Louys of Delasco should have environned the city of Gulic with 30 companyes of horsemen.

It is also sayd that Monsieur de la Moterie Governour of Mastrie / shalt goe above in Ger∣many with 12. thousand Spanish soldiers / and that he should have the place of Buequoy: It is sayd that he takes his waye thorough Lotharing to Bavieres: the Prince Barbanson is to bee Governour in his place.

From France / there is yet a continuance of the Warres by the King against his subjets. Clerac being taken the camp is gone towards Montau∣ban with the Prince of Conde / they doe already Parlement as men say.

It is also sayd that the King of Swede with an 150. shipp of soldiers is gon towards Riga in Lyfland and that it is already very hard besidge: and because there is small garnison in it / as also no hope of helpe it is tanght that it wil not long continue.
The soldiers of Dane marck and Brunswic / are sayd to marche towards Westfalen / we shalt shortly heare where they goe.
Twesday last the Prince of Orange / is wel arryved to the City of Arnhem / the soldiers doe marche in great nomber towards the monstering place / which shall bedone with the first oppertu∣nitye.
Thursday in the evening the King of Bohemia arryved to Dtrecht he goeth also higher / wee shalt here in tyme where.

P.HI: AT AMSTERDAM Printed by George Veseler. The 6. of Septembre. 1621.
